Package ctlogo.data

Interface VariableManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GlobalVariableManager, LocalVariableManager
    public interface VariableManager
    Variable manager used in context
    Author:
    Paul Yang A VariableManager is defined for each context at runtime, meaning that whenever a context is created, a new VariableManager is created.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • isDefined

        boolean isDefined​(java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        whether the variable is defined in context.

      • isDefinedLocally

        boolean isDefinedLocally​(java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        whether the variable is defined locally.

      • getValue

        CTValue getValue​(java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        the variable If this has enclosed some other VariableManager, this method shall return the local variable if found, otherwise, return the variable from higher level.
        Throws:
        CTVariableNotDefinedException - if the variable name is not defined.

      • tryGetValue

        CTValue tryGetValue​(java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        the variable is it is already defined, otherwise. If this has enclosed some other VariableManager, this method shall return the local variable if found, otherwise, return the variable from higher level.

      • setVariable

        CTValue setVariable​(java.lang.String name,
                    CTValue value)
        Parameters:
        name -
        variable -
        Returns:
        the variable be replaced. If there is no variable being replace, then shall be returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if trying to set the variable to null ( (in Java) Remark: if a variable is to be hidden, then it is not considered as replaced.

        Throws:
